alert.note: Alert for Joshua Tree NP East; Joshua Tree NP West (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued February 15 at 7:42AM PST until February 15 at 7:00PM PST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MST /7 PM PST/ THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Southwest winds 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 40 mph expected. * WHERE...In Arizona, Gila River Valley, Southeast Yuma County, Kofa, Parker Valley, Central La Paz County and Yuma. In California, Eastern portion of Joshua Tree National Park and Western portion of Joshua Tree National Park. * WHEN...Until 8 PM MST /7 PM PST/ this evening. * IMPACTS...Difficult driving conditions, especially for larger vehicles traveling along roads with crosswinds. Light, unsecured objects may become airborne.
info.instruction: A Wind Advisory means that sustained wind speeds of between 30 and 40 mph are expected, or wind gusts of between 40 and 58 mph. Winds this strong can make driving difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. In addition, strong winds over desert areas could result in briefly lowered visibilities to well under a mile at times in blowing dust or blowing sand. Use extra caution.

area.areaDesc: Joshua Tree NP East; Joshua Tree NP West
